titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: 1. VI. Saturday. Rain— Alr. M’Rae here. His conversation at Richmond last June— Concerted explosion about this time intended— His conversation yesterday with G. Hay. Opinion of him— J. H. Pleasants— L. Webster his Cousin. Shewed him Pleasants’s last Letter— M’Rae’s paper, different from Pleasants’s. He going to Europe— Lieutt. Washington, called at house and Office— Gave him a Messengers Passport, and Letters to H. Nelson and T. Appleton at Leghorn— Evening copying papers.

2. VI— St. John’s Church. Heard Hawley. Luke 16.25— Versified 42 Psalm. Afternoon at Presbyterian Church. Heard Strangers— Hosea—6.4— Dr Janeway announced for Evening— Abigail S. Adams arrived with her uncle Charles Harrod— He dined with us, and pass’d the Evening. Cold—

3. VI: Rising Sun— At the Office— Seaton; for Brannan— Wyer. Despatch from R. Rush—South-America. Mary Hellen came home; with Mr and Mrs Thompson. Ch. Harrod dined with us. Goes for New-Orleans to morrow. Dr. Watkins here this Eve— Catlet’s Letter— Watkins’s Son—for Secretary of Legation— Watkins has my Russian despatch Book. Mrs Adams ill in bed.

4. VI. Rising Sun—finished— Charles the 5th— Fletcher, for Unitarian Church. Rice with Barrow, a claimant of the West-Florida party, Kemper’s Constituents, and G. Johnson with his books here. Jer: Robinson at the Office— Company to dine— H. U. Addington, James Bakerde Bresson, Com: Chauncey, L. Cheves, G. Hay, Hersant, Jackson, M’Tavish, Baron Maltitz, Manly, Parish, Peirce, Petry, Come. PorterSeawell, Baron Stackelberg, G. Sullivan, and Baron Tuyll— All came but G. Hay and Porter— Mrs Adams keeps her bed.

5. VI.Mr T. Lowndes here. Going to-morrow for Charleston. Secy of the Navy, S. Southard; just returned from Trenton— G. Johnson— His books to be corrected— Advances to be checked— At the Office, met G. Hay. Randall with Letter from Judah Lord— At P.U.S— This morning from Loudoun. Rush’s despatches. South-America— G. Canning— H. Nelson. Appleton—and much else— Eve at home— Charles the 5th.

6. VI. Rain. Deabbate, Sardinian Chargè d’Affaires, here with Documents— Ringgold at the Office; about the Georgia Lands. I have had two Letters from his brother— Little, with a further part of his commercial digest— Addington— Conversation concerning South-America— At P.U.S. He appointed a Meeting for to-morrow— Proposal to communicate Canning’s Overtures to Salazar—Minister to France— Gallatin cannot go this Winter. Potowmack Canal Meeting— Johnson Hellen here, a Delegate. Mr Frye passed the Evening and supped with us— Charles 5ths Clocks.
7. V:30. Rain. Cabinet Meeting— Canning’s proposals to R. Rush— Answer to Tuyll’s Note, about South-America—sent for Tuyll to come to-morrow at one— Evening record

8. V:30. Thornton here— Attended the Meeting of the Delegates on the Chesapeake and Ohio canals— Their debates— Passed their amended Resolutions— Called out by Alr. M’Rae—called out G. Hay. Told him of my Correspondence with J. H. Pleasants— Baron Tuyll. Conference with him— Advice to the Emperor— Answer to Tuyll’s note— Dined at Brown’s Hotel, with the Delegates—invited by the Citizens of the District of Columbia— Home with M’Lean.

9. VI. Sleepless Night. Heard Little. 2. Thessalonians 3.1.2. and in the Evening 10. Acts 34.35. Afternoon Sunday School Addresses, at Baker’s Church— Cards to D. Trimble and Coll. Eustis— G. Hay here— Shewed him correspondence with Pleasants— D. Brent and A. Lee here. Also A. Armstrong— Tuyll’s draft of a despatch.
